dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is car seven in green sector, we're in pursuit of a blue Lincoln Continental, Jersey plates five, niner, five, alpha, alpha, zulu travelling south on Park Row, subjects armed and dangerous. Request road block units on all lanes. With Chen and Wallace closing in, Gangster #2 unloads ano burst of gunfire. One of the bullets punctures the windsh grazes Wallace's ear, exploding the headrest behind him. continues to catch up as the Lincoln makes a sharp left slipping through the cross traffic. The Chevy's not as lu as it gets clipped in the rear causing it to spin 90 degr and slowing their pursuit. EXT: PELL STREET (N.Y.) - DAY The Lincoln moves fast down Pell and hangs a sharp right careening onto Bowery heading downtown. Chen and Wallace struggle to keep up with pedestrians scattering in all directions. Just as the gangsters reach the first stoplig turns green. They pull out into the oncoming lane cutting front of the waiting traffic which is just starting to mo In order to stop them and pin the Chevy in, gangster#2 le loose a barrage of gunfire which mows down the drivers of first row of car, pinning the Chevy behind the bloody roadblock. The Lincoln takes off to the right. Chen backs sees an opening to an alley parallel to the street and ta off down it hoping to cut them off. EXT: SPADINA ALLEY (TOR) - DAY  Chen and Wallace speed through the narrow pasageway check through the periodic openings to Temperance Street trying track the Lincoln.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! Chen floors it- comes flying out the end of the alley on EXT: NARROW DOWNTOWN STREET (TOR) - DAY Cars parked on both sides of the street. Chen comes right up beside the Lincoln and tries to force to a stop by pushing it up against the parked cars but th Lincoln just keeps charging, banging an opening through t cars and jumping onto the sidewalk knocking down a half-d pedestrians who can't get out of the way fast enough. Che tracks alongside- gangster#2 spraying automatic fire at t smashing out the windows of the parked cars. Chen and Wal do their best to return fire. A delivery truck straddles sidewalk in front of the Lincoln, instead of slowing, the speed up and at the last moment crash through parked cars forcing an opening for them to come back onto the street. parked car they punched through now blocks the Chevy. Rat than stop, Chen blasts onto the opposite sidewalk, pulls next to the Lincoln while he and Wallace try to blow it o Suddenly there's an elderly woman pulling her shopping ba in front of them who can't possibly get out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Civilian!! Chen jams on the brakes, slides through an opening of par cars and follows the Lincoln around the corner to the lef EXT: POST OFFICE ALLEY - DAY Gangster #2 seeing the Chevy gaining on them, leans far o his passenger side window and sprays the Lincoln's tires before a truck pulls out from a loading dock and sends th gangster’s body flying through the air like a puppet. The Lincoln doesn't even slow. The Chevy spins uncontrollably front end smashing into the elevated lift of a meat truck which cuts right through the windshield pinning Chen behi collapsed steering column. Both men, shaken, watch as the Lincoln heads for the end the street, then suddenly pulls a smoky 180 and heads rig back towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is he doing? The Lincoln drives straight at them with the now visible and WHITES tailing it in close pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Chen and Wallace try and climb from the Chevy. Wallace ca Chen can't. He's trapped behind the wheel. Chen looks at Wallace who stands beside the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! Chen begins firing at the Lincoln. Wallace looking betwee Chen and the fast approaching car, fires also. Chen's gun empties. Because of the chaos of the delivery trucks, the Lincoln has only one way out, and that is to crash straig through the disabled Chevy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said go! Chen empties his gun. Wallace refuses to leave him. The Lincoln is forty yards, thirty yards. It's engine is deafening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallace stays, firing everything he's got. Out of ammo, h quickly turns, dives back in the ca and grabs the shotgun the back seat. Twenty yards, ten yards, he sees the face the DRIVER when he gets lucky and a shotgun blast hits th gangster in the chest. The Lincoln spins out of control, twirling like crazy before it hits one of the trucks and explodes in flames. Wallace pulls Chen down as the fireba rolls just over their heads. Chen looks at Wallace as the up.  omitted    INT: INTERROGATION ROOM TWO - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Federal agent Ronald Ming is dead. Shot seven times in the back and I’m thinking some scumbag in the Fifteenth is responsible. Chen insides are twisted in knots. Half of him wants to c clean, but the self preservation half knows to play it co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe some scumbag in the Bureau is responsible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And maybe I’m gonna grow a tree out of my dick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If anybody could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you can bet your ass it’d be an Oak. Schabacker stares at Chen looking for the slightest flinc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We I.D’d the shooters...They’re Fukienese. Chen breathes a touch easier. Maybe it wasn’t Lee. Maybe was part of the turf war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuke’s have been makin a move on the triads for months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That’s the only thing keepin me from ripping this fuckin precinct to the ground. That...and this. Schabacker puts a small tape on the desk. Chen looks at t wondering if he’s on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The assholes were in such a hurry to get moving they didn’t check the bodies for wires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who’s on it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny Wong. Some others. Three weeks worth of undercover work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A court’ll never admit it without the agent backin it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will once you tell ‘em you’ve been working with us on this investigation. That after the shooting and before the chase, you entered the building, approached our agent who, with his last breath, told you he got this tape and corroborated what’s on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That’s perjury. Why would I do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To keep me from bringing charges against you for obstructing a federal investigation. Wallace told us how you engaged in the unauthorized surveillance of a federal agent, which possibly blew his cover, resulting in his assassination. Chen looks at Schabacker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That speech may have shivered a rookie, but you’ll need better for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I’ll tell you what. You better watch your back cause my gut’s still tellin me somebody in the Fifteenth gave my guy up and if I can’t have Uncle Benny, I’m gonna have him. Chen looks into Schabacker’s face. omitted INT: WALLACE’s APARTMENT - LATER Wallace, dressed only in pants, cracks open the front doo sees Chen standing in the doorway. The visit catches Wall off guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then invite me in. Wallace opens the door wider and Chen steps inside. He lo around the small apartment filled with boxes and Chinese artifacts with cops eyes. The kind that make you nervous if you’ve done nothing wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got something to drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About yesterday. You saved my life out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part of the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. I still want to say thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what it means I saved your life. Chen smiles as he causually but carefully looks through t papers on Wallace’s coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is America, it doesn’t mean anything. That said...Feds got you nervous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Cause whether it’s the Feds, Internal Affairs, whoever, the inside of a cop car is sacred. You don’t tell them what we do unless you discuss it with me first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the sudden paranoia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m just sayin’. Anybody asks you a question. You ask me first. Chen crosses to Wallace and stands face to face with him, making his point clear. No more talking with the Feds until we’re working off the same page. Understood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Chen turns and walks out the door. Wallace lets out a bre omitted EXT: THE TOMBS - DAY New York’s city prison and holding facility. Like any toi it’s filled with shit.  omitted INT: THE TOMBS - INTERROGATION ROOM  Sitting behind a desk is Chen. The Guards put Jack in a c then step back into the hall. Chen eyes the kid who looks smaller in his prison rags. He waits a moment, then puts surveillance photo of Jack’s girlfriend Amy San on the ta between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice looking girl. Did you know she’s in the country illegally? Jack looks from the picture to Chen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna have to send her back...after a little jail time of course. Shame you two’ll never see each other again. Jack’s toughness is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can’t send her, she’s in trouble there. She’ll be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad. I can’t help you. That’s what you told me isn’t it? Jack feels the noose closing around his neck. He doesn’t much choice. He speaks quietly, already afraid of what he to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I help you, when they move me, she come too, with papers? Chen nods, then places a small tape recorder on the table Jack looks at it like it was poison. Chen then puts a bus card beside it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pager number. Punch one one after your number so I know it’s you. Jack reaches for the card and recorder. When he does, Che grabs his wrist and pulls him closer. I get you out, you better not run on me. Jack looks at Chen and knows he’s serious. I want to know who shot that undercover Fed. And I want to know if whoever it was talks to Henry Lee Chen lets go of Jack and motions to the Guards. They reen the room, pick up Jack and take him back to his cell. Che watches him go and it’s clear he doesn’t feel good about he just did. EXT: CHEN’S APARTMENT, MOTT STREET - DAY A truck filled with dead pigs hanging on hooks, stands on corner. MEN carry said swine to small vans parked at the curb.Chen, carrying groceries, walks past the workmen and to his door. He glances toward the vans as he slides in h key. INT: CHEN’S APARTMENT, MOTT STREET - DAY Chen, still struggling with the death of the undercover a plops the package on the table, takes out a bottle of Bac and cracks the seal. He pours a portion of it into a half empty liter of Coke and hits it as he crosses to the wind looks at the meat vans. INT: CHEN’S APARTMENT MOTT STREET - DAY He picks up the phone and punches in a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New York Times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just called to tell you that Pete Schabacker of the F.B.I. is a hemorrhoid-licking asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? Chen hangs up, sips his muscled Big Gulp and finally has something to laugh about.  INT: MEAT VAN, MOTT STREET - DAY Tucked inside one of the meat vans, is a reel-to-reel recorder, Pete Schabacker and two hysterical AGENTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up. INT: HOSPITAL, SEAN WALLACE’S ROOM - DAY Wallace moves past the other patients to his father’s bed where the big Irishman lies with his eyes closed. Wallace looks down at him, then starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Wallace turns back to the bed. His father smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Wallace isn’t sure what he’s talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the money. They sent a guy, he told me you settled up. I’m not gonna forget it. INT: LEE’S OFFICE - NIGHT Lee sits behind his desk when Wallace storms into the roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you cover my father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m helping you because I want you to help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My business is victimless. I supply services people want and are forbidden to them by politicians. However, you’ve seen there’re those whose business is not victimless. Whose tactic is violence. I can help you rid Chinatown of those elements, and help keep your father alive. All I ask, is that you look out for my interests in return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You’re asking for more than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long after you and I are gone there will be gambling in Chinatown. There will be men willing to pay a woman for her favors. And the police will always be the last to know. That’s a fact...Now you can chase your tail in the dark and accomplish nothing, or you can really do some good. For the people of Chinatown, for your career and for your father. Lee circles his table and approaches Wallace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think of how many more young girls would have ended up in dumpsters if not for your acceptance of my help. Wallace does think about it. Knowing that they did save l He looks out the window at a bustling Chinatown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn’t America, Danny. It’s Chinatown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we agree?...Or do you want me to call the Italians and rescind my offer? Let them deal with your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moment of choice. Its consequences are not lost on Wallace. The decision is not easy...but slowly, he shakes head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. There’s something I’d like you to do for me tomorrow. Lee doesn’t speak right away. He makes Wallace wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There’s a tin shop on Hogan. omitted EXT: TIN SHOP - HOGAN STREET - MORNING(DAY) Wallace steps from the subway, crosses to a newsstand, bu paper and checks the timepiece hanging over the porn mags 5:58AM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Malaysian runs it. Tomorrow at six AM, he’ll be receiving two bricks of heroin from a Colombian. He clocks the tin shop. He can make out the MALAYSIAN guy behind the counter and a MALE CUSTOMER, Chinese, checking racks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These men are scum, they deal to children. I’d like you to stop them. He takes position at the bus stop on the corner and waits sees an HISPANIC MALE, 40’s, enter the store. The Malaysi locks the front door and leads the Hispanic to the rear o shop. He moves quickly across Hogan. He reaches the front door, slides the slim jim from his jacket, and easily opens the lock. INT: TIN SHOP - CONTINUOUS - DAY Wallace pulls the Glock from his holster. He hears voices behind the rear door. Cold sweat runs down his neck as he takes position. He steadies himself, then kicks open the INT: TIN SHOP OFFICE - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He aims his gun and nearly fires when he hears YELLING fr one of the men and sees the barrel of a .45 pointed at hi face. But he doesn’t shoot because the gun belongs to Chen, in middle of busting the two drug dealers. Eyes wild and still YELLING, Chen nearly squeezes the tri himself, but his brain registers Wallace faster than his finger. The two cops, breathing hard, stare at each other knowing exactly how the other got there. After a moment, Chen cuf the two prisoners to the radiator and pushes Wallace back the store. INT: TIN SHOP - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch. When did Lee approach you?! The bust on Chrystie, right? The porn operation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it. I knew your story was full of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well here you are. When did he approach you? I bet quite a while before that. When was it, two years ago, five years? How long have you been working for him? Or can’t you even remember?! Chen grabs Wallace by the neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You’re dead. Your life is over. I thought you were smart. You’re not, you’re as dumb as they come. Chen lets go of Wallace. It takes a moment and then it hi him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave him the Fed didn’t you? Chen looks back at Wallace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That’s why we were watching them. That’s why you pressed that kid so hard to wear a wire. Yeah I heard about that. You want to see if it was the Fukes who killed the agent or if it was Lee. They hear something behind them and turn with guns pointe a seventy year old Woman stepping through the door.   INT: GAMBLING PARLOR - DAY Chen moves purposefully through the crowded room but he doesn’t stop to play. Instead he strides up to Henry Lee, grabs him and forcefully pushes him down the hall and out the back alley. INT: GAMBLING PARLOR, STAIRWAY - DAY He punches Lee to the floor. Lee’s Sumo and two other tri SOLDIERS race into the room, guns drawn, but hold back fr firing because Chen’s gun is pointed at Lee’s head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You brought him in, not me. I couldn’t risk it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had him under control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What’s done is done. You know that better than anyone. You want to help him? Smarten him up. Make sure he doesn’t trip over his toes and fuck both of you. I hear dirty cops have an extra rough time of it in prison. Chen looks right into Lee’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I find out you killed that Fed, I’ll kill you. Chen strides from the room, keeping his gun pointed on ta omitted EXT: SECOND STREET - DAY Chen and Wallace move across the street. The mood is sole

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wires. You never know who’s wearin one so assume everyone is.  Chen stops at an outdoor fruit stand and samples the good Another thing. If you hear something in the precinct you think we should pass along, always double check. It could be a bogus tip they wanted you to hear to see if it got passed along. Black or red plum?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don’t like plums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don’t like plums?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like peaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peaches are shit. Didn’t you ever hear that song Sinatra sang, "Out of the tree of life I just picked me a plum?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don’t care if he picked a raisin out of Sammy Davis’ eye socket. I like peaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I’m not paying for it. Chen pays for his plum and Wallace pays for his peach. Ch stops to watch a bunch of KIDS playing soccer in the park

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How’d they get to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was the first Chinese cop in the Fifteenth. Thought I was gonna clean up Chinatown. But white cops wouldn’t work with me and the people wouldn’t talk to a cop, Chinese or not. Only Uncle Benny paid me any attention. He became my godfather, took care of my debts. Henry Lee was his lieutenant. He fed me a few busts, made me look good and I liked it. Then one night my father walks into a gambling house and ends up dead. Turns out Lee knew there was a contract on him. Made it clear he could’ve told me, I could’ve stopped it...Got me thinking I was better at my job with him, than without him. The soccer ball rolls over and Chen kicks it back into th game. And he was right. Chen takes a bite from his plum as the sound of a shutter 35mm camera clicking stops the action in beautiful black white. Suddenly, a hand reaches in and pulls the photo of wall.   INT: FBI HEADQUARTERS HALLWAY - DAY Schacker walks briskly through the hallway carrying the picture and talking on a cordless mouthpiece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s Schabacker. I want everything you have on a Detective in the Fifteenth Precinct. His name is Daniel Wallace...Yeah his old man worked crooked outta the two five, check on him too. He rounds a corner and approaches his office where Benny his lawyer and two Fed minions sit waiting for him. INT: SCHABACKER'S OFFICE - DAY He enters, closing the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wong, we’re running a one day sale. Chance of a lifetime. The opportunity to buy your freedom. Schabacker pulls an audio tape from his desk drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This tape was obtained by an agent working undercover inside the Triad. It’s Cantonese but the look on Wong’s face tells us it is good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tape is garbage. If it weren’t, you would have arrested my client by now. Schabacker lays an arrest warrant on the table and speaks Wong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawyers are always gutsy when it’s someone else looking at life. But I don’t want you. I want whoever killed my agent. I want the cops in the Fifteenth on your payroll. And I’m willing to pay for it. omitted  INT: FUKIENESE CRASH PAD, BEDROOM - NIGHT The phone rings as Bobby Vu makes out with a good looking girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. INT: GREEN MERCEDES-SAME NIGHT Lee rides in back, speaking into his cell-phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our patience has paid off. Uncle Benny paid a visit to the F.B.I. His time is over. omitted INT: FUKIENESE CRASH PAD, LIVING ROOM - SAME NIGHT The room looks like home to seven teenagers who drink, do drugs, fight and play with guns all day. Four of them, including Jack, are on the couch, watching porno. The bed door opens and Bobby Vu enters, kicking everybody off the couches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get dressed, we have a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We take care of Benny Wong tonight. omitted EXT: CHEN’S APARTMENT, MOTT STREET - NIGHT Wallace drives to the curb as Chen looks at the Phone Com truck parked across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friends are waiting for me. Wallace glances at the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long you think the Feds’ll be watching us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Month, maybe two. Chen can see that fact rattles Wallace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn’t want Lee involving you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn’t say it was. What I’m saying is you’re alone now. You can’t trust anybody in the department. Not the guys in the Fifteenth, not the guys in the AGU. And you sure as hell can’t trust Henry Lee. So if anything gets sticky, you come to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I know I can trust you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don’t. Chen opens the car door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m glad it’s not just me...Nuts huh? Half of him feels the same way...But the smarter half, th self preservation half, doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna eat? I’ll buy you a plum. Chen smiles. He wants to, but he closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some other time. Wallace drives off as Chen turns and pushes into his buil INT: CHEN’S BUILDING, HALLWAY OUTSIDE HIS APARTMENT - NIG Lying against the door, cold and pasty white, is May. Che quickly checks her vitals, then lifts her in his arms and carries her back outside. EXT: GAS STATION, QUEENS-NIGHT The Fukienese crew sit packed into a stolen Buick Regal a of the boys pumps unleaded into the tank. Jack in the mid of the back seat fidgets like an inmate on death row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta take a leak. Bobby Vu looks at him with the impatience of a killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up. Jack climbs out the door. He crosses the forty yards of asphalt and moves behind the filling station to the side the building. EXT: GAS STATION PAY PHONE - NIGHT  He stops at a payphone nestled between the men’s and lady rooms. His hands tremble as he slides in the quarter and the number off Chen’s card. He checks the number of the p punches it in along with his code. He hits the pound key, hangs up and waits. omitted INT: HUDSON ST CLINIC, HOSPITAL ROOM - NIGHT The population, STAFF and CLIENTELE, is mostly Asian, Spa and poor. The pace is fast and the care minimal by necess Behind a curtain, May lies sleeping, I.V. tubing supplyin nutrition, an oxygen mask supplying life. Chen watches he when his pager goes off. He checks the number, recognizin pager code he gave Jack as a young DOCTOR enters the area

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She’s lucky you found her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to write her up as deceased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She recovers, she goes to work. Two weeks she’s back here, maybe not so lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You’re asking a lot. Chen reaches into his pocket and pulls out ten hundred do bills. The Doctor thinks, then takes the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her stay a few days, till she’s stronger. Then I’ll come get her. Chen looks at May then slips outside. EXT: GAS STATION, PAYPHONE - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing? Jack spins and calls on every ounce of strength he has to from turning white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m sick. I wasn’t sure if I had to go back inside or not. Bobby Vu starts to smile...until the phone rings. Then he stares at Jack, who ignores the ringing phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m alright. Let’s go. Bobby stops him...and picks up the phone. He puts the rec to his ear, but doesn’t say a word. INT: HUDSON STREET CLINIC - SAME (NIGHT) Chen stands at a payphone and almost speaks, but the sile on the other end of the line stops him. EXT: GAS STATION, PAYPHONE - NIGHT Jack’s legs nearly buckle as Bobby Vu keeps the phone to ear. The wait is agony, but gets interrupted when Black E walks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What’re you doing? INT: HUDSON STREET CLINIC - NIGHT Chen hears the voices through the phone line and realizes something’s not right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this Domino’s Pizza? EXT: GAS STATION, PAYPHONE - NIGHT Jack continues to watch Bobby Vu, who hangs up without sa a word. Slowly, a smile curls his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack thought he was gonna shit his pants. He puts an arm around his soldier and leads him to the Bu INT: HUDSON STREET CLINIC - NIGHT Chen hangs up the phone. He stands a moment, then takes a from his pocket and writes down the number on the pager. EXT: BENNY WONG’S HOUSE, FLUSHING QUEENS-NIGHT Chinatown Two and definitely the nicest. An upper income, suburban neighborhood populated by American-born Chinese. Out front of the gated corner house is the Bobby Vu’s car Fukeniese fan out around the walls surrounding the proper omitted INT: BENNY WONG’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Benny Wong sits in a club chair watching an episode of Si when he hears the KRAK KRAK KRAK of gunfire coming from i his house.  He quickly searches his desk drawer finding a .38 caliber pistol. He turns toward the door and freezes as he looks the eyes of Bobby Vu and the other three Fukienese who po submachine guns at his chest. Bobby Vu smiles....Benny Wo stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You’re not man enough to kill me. In a flash, Benny brings the revolver to his temple and s himself. Bobby Vu looks at the old man lying dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We kill you anyway. The four youths open up, turning Benny Wong into hamburge omitted

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT: BENNY WONG'S BATHROOM - NIGHT The door opens and Bobby Vu enters. He lifts the lid and begins to pee unaware of MRS. WONG who lies paralyzed wit fear in the bathtub.  She tries to lie quietly as he unzips his pants. The soun liquid hitting liquid mixes with the faint cry of police sirens in the distance. He finishes, takes one step toward the exit then turns an begins firing into the glass shower door. He stops. Walks through the smoke filled room and stands over Mrs. Wong, alive, but cut to pieces in the bottom of the tub. He loo down at her and nonchalantly points his gun at her chest. begins to cry as he pulls the trigger. EXT: WORTH STREET-DAY HENRY LEE stands outside his restaurant greeting people w pay respects to him as though it were a coronation. Ung, Wallace and Chen buy frozen ices from a street cart trying to make a buck in the ninety degree heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been able to reach Jack yet? Chen shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paged him fifty times and nothing. He’s hidin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think he was calling about the hit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was on it. Wallace looks at all the people greeting Lee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody seems too upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except them. Across the way, they see an FBI surveillance VAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin Feds...Dumb shit brings Benny Wong into the federal building, should’ve just taken an ad out in the papers. They suck on their freeze bars when Chen notices three li CHINESE kids looking at the ice cream. Chen looks at the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stay in school? The kids nod. Chen hands the vendor a ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set ‘em up. The youngsters clamor for the ices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatdaya think Lee’s gonna do about the Fuke’s now that he’s top dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He’s made his deal with the Fukes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what I want to do. Chen stares at Lee with complete hate. omitted INT: FIFTEENTH PRECINCT, OUTSIDE THE AGU OFFICES - DAY Through the glass door we see Wallace and Ung catch up on paperwork as Detective Deng comes through it, into the ha where the coffee machine sits. She pours black coffee int thirty-ounce cup, then hits it with a half dozen sugars. walks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Planning on staying up for a month?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait till you have a baby...Did you hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’ve heard the FEDS have a case against someone in the Fifteenth. This gets Chen’s attention, but he tries to dismiss it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’ve heard that every month for ten years. Deng presses, like she’s trying to tell Chen something mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So have I, but this time I hear they have tapes, photos, the whole nine yards. They’re pissed off about their agent and Benny Wong getting killed and they want to hang somebody for it.  Chen nods to his partner as she heads back to her desk. C thinks for a moment, then looks through the glass at Wall working away. omitted INT: GAMBLING PARLOR - DAY Chen enters the underground parlor. But today it’s empty, except for Henry Lee, the Sumo, two other triad soldiers the dealer from last nights gambling. Lee is here to coll his cut. His minions immediately frisk Chen and take his from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think I have a reason to use them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m not sure. Lately you’ve forgotten that what happens to me, happens to you. Lee makes sure Chen gets the message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Feds are making a case against Wallace. We need to cut him loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You’re nervous. You’re getting soft in your old age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only thing going soft is your brain. The Sumo smashes Chen into the wall and down to the groun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Personal attacks are going to get us nowhere, Detective. Chen can barely breathe, let alone get to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I’ll tell you what. I’ll take your advice to a point. I’ll sever any traceable ties between us...and give Wallace a few arrests to knock the shoo-flies off his heels. Lee and his men start for the door, then stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I almost forgot in all this hub-bub. He peels several bills from his takings and drops it on t floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today’s payday for dirty cops. Make sure you give Wallace his cut. He smiles and walks out the door. Chen, still on the grou watches him go...then picks up the money. EXT: FIFTEENTH PRECINCT - DAY Chen walks up Elizabeth Street toward the station entranc when he sees Wallace hurrying out of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallace. The young cop either ignores the sound or didn’t hear it, cause he heads straight for a patrol car parked at the ba the police lot. Chen yells after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where’re you going? Wallace stops, lets Chen catch up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee’s not covering my old man with the Italians. I gotta move him. He starts towards his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the hell’d you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because the Feds are building a case against you. The words hit Wallace like a jack hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. And if they nab you it’ll take three seconds for you to give them me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you would...And so would I. Wallace turns away. Watches some cops heading off duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m not saying it’s fatal. Point now is to cover tracks and keep everything clean on the surface. And when they call you in, keep your mouth shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I never got into this. Chen can’t help feeling sorry for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and me both. Chen reaches into his pocket and takes out the money he g from Lee, careful that no one sees him. He peels off seve bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your cut from Lee. Three grand. Wallace looks at Chen. He doesn’t want to touch the money...but he needs it. So he slips it into his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where’re you gonna move him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Chen looks at him, then holds out the rest of the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This’ll cover your old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can’t.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just take it. Wallace hesitates, but takes the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember. Don’t say anything. Let me deal with the Feds. Alright? Wallace nods and heads for his car. INT: AMY SAN’S BEDROOM, BROOKLYN-DAY Jack and Amy watch TV when Chen breaks in the window besi them. Jack grabs for his gun but Chen pins his arm to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to find, Jack. Chen grabs Jack’s gun and slides it into his own belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her to take in a movie.  Jack utters a few words in Fukienese and the young girl g her clothes and hurries out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to call. I couldn’t.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I’m here. So what did you want to tell me about Benny Wong? EXT: JACOBI HOSPITAL, BRONX-LATER (DAY) Wallace stops in the no parking section in front of the clinic. He pops the "police tag" on the dash, gets out an heads inside. EXT: JACOBI HOSPITAL STREET - DAY Across the street, two FEDS snap photos of Wallace from a omitted INT: JACOBI HOSPITAL, BRONX - day Wallace approaches the front desk when someone calls his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel Wallace. Wallace turns and sees the two Feds moving toward him. He quickly hands the envelope to the RECEPTIONIST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you pass this letter to my father in room 409? Sean Wallace. Before she can answer, the Feds are on him flashing badge the larger Agent reaches for Wallace’s gun. Back off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don’t be an asshole. He again reaches for Wallace’s gun but Wallace pushes him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don’t touch my gun or my badge dipshit. I work in the Fifteenth. Wallace stares at the two agents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Let’s just get out of here quietly. There’s a couple questions we’d like to ask you. Wallace continues to stare, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We’ll have someone on his door. After a moment, Wallace turns to the flustered Receptioni holding the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. He then walks toward the door with the two Feds behind hi INT: AMY SAN'SBEDROOM, BROOKLYN - SAME (DAY) Chen leans against the wall as Jack puts on his clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then everybody split up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. You’re under arrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! Chen slaps on the cuffs and turns the kid around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You’re gonna tell the Feds you’ve been working with Wallace and me. That the hit on Benny Wong was Fukienese and you’re eager to testify against Bobby Vu. Do it right and I’ll back you on trying to tip me before the hit. Do it wrong, I’ll go out of my way to bury you. Chen hustles the kid out the door.   INT: SCHABACKER’S OFFICE, FEDERAL BUILDING-DAY Wallace sits alone in the office looking at the stack of photos depicting his actions over the past few days. He a sees photos of Chen with May. He looks at the young girl recognizes her from the raid on the Ginza Massage. He looks up as a pissed off Schabacker and NYPD Internal Affairs Inspector Vince Kirpatrick enter the tiny room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the fuck didn’t you tell me you were Internal Affairs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confidential undercover assignment. The key word being confidential. Which nothing in the Bureau is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody knows except a few of us in IA. Not even the commanding officer in the Fifteenth knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well now I know. Schabacker looks at Wallace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bagman’s kid, Internal Affairs. You’re old man must think you’re a real scumbag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what he thinks of Feds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. So what have you got on Chen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn’t a federal case. So there’s no reason to tell you anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, there is. Cause from where I’m sitting it looks to me like a young, I.A. rat went under to build a case against Nick Chen and ended up working for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You’re reaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoying for himself the Chinatown whores and a little financial assistance to help with a family gambling problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don’t even start with that. One of the arresting Agents enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’ll start and finish with it unless somebody hands me Chen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He’s here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who’s here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chen. INT: CONFERENCE ROOM, FEDERAL BUILDING - CONTINUOUS (DAY) Chen and Jack sit as Schabacker enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Pete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Nick...Who’s your friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A snitch of Wallace’s and mine. He’s an eye witness to the Benny Wong murder. Schabacker sits back into his chair and offers Chen some

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cashews? They both sit, munching their nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eye witness...And you brought him here to me? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why. The two cops sit looking at one another. INT: SCHABACKER’S OFFICE, FEDERAL BUILDING-LATER (DAY) The same crew as before sit when Schabacker re-enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My compliments, Wallace. You must’ve sunk your hooks into Chen pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What’d he want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To trade for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in so many words. He brought that Fuke snitch of yours who rode shotgun on the Benny Wong killing. He gives me the eye witness, I call off the FBI investigation on Wallace. Wallace feels more like a shit as Schabacker talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What’d you tell him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him fine. We’re puttin the kid on the street to get the rest of the Fukes on tape talking about the hit on Benny Wong. And in return, I’m not going to press charges against young Wallace here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he still here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He took off. Schabacker leans back in his chair and smiles at Wallace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta promise me I can be there when you break the bad news to Chen. That’s gonna be priceless. Wallace feels a heavy weight lay across his shoulders. EXT: SOUTHERN MANHATTAN - NIGHT Establishing. Clouds drift over the city making the famil landmarks almost unrecognizable. INT: WALLACE APARTMENT, BEDROOM-NIGHT Wallace opens a safe box he has on the bed. Inside are au tapes. Dates and names written across the labels. Chen’s most. Lee on others. He grabs a blank tape and pops it in recorder. He crosses to a mirror, opens his belt hides the recorder his underpants. He buckles up and runs a wire up his ches gently tapes it to the inside of his shirt, then buttons He tucks in the shirt tails and repositions the recorder. Finished, he stares at himself. Not liking what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wire’s showin. Wallace turns and sees his father leaning against the doorway. Sean walks over and roughly fixes his son’s shirt. Wallace pulls away and fixes it himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long you been I.A.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First assignment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quickest way to a gold shield. Wallace doesn’t say a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And all you’ve got to do is bury your partner. The guy who shoved ten grand in your fist to back your play.  Wallace looks at his father, wonders how he knows. Wallace’s lack of a response tells his father he’s right. And you’re gonna bury him. And for what? Turning his head and makin a few dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that wouldn’t mean much to you. Lyin and cheatin are what you’re made of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it’s a hell of a lot better than what you’re made of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don’t know what I’m made of. It’s the one thing I should thank you for, your lack of interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah you’ve been real honest with your partner. Wallace looks away from his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: End justifies the means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The end is bullshit. The means are what you live with. Sean reaches into his jacket, holds out Chen’s money and tosses it on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it. I don’t want anything from you. Sean Wallace turns out of the room. His son looks back in mirror and does a last adjustment on his wire.  He then reaches for the cologne on the dresser, splashes into his palm and hurls the bottle against the wall. omitted omitted INT: GAMBLING PARLOR - LATER (NIGHT)  The joint is packed. At a center table Chen is teaching Wallace and two beauties named KIM and TAI, the finer poi of Pai Gou. One of the girl’s got a hot hand and can’t se make a wrong move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celebrating. You just got off death row. INT: HOTEL SUITE - LATER (NIGHT) The foursome slide into the dimly lit room with bottles o champagne in tow. Chen and Kim are already halfway to one the bedrooms before Wallace has the door locked. He turns and Tai has herself draped over him with her han headed for his crotch. He holds her off, conscious of the recorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait, wait. She looks at him confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don’t like me? Wallace looks at the beauty and kisses her full on the mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got to go to the bathroom first. INT: HOTEL BATHROOM - CONTINUOUS (NIGHT) Wallace, drunk, locks the door behind him. He splashes wa on his face, then glances up at himself in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck’re you doin? He then takes off the wire and removes the recorder from shorts. He takes off his jacket, puts the device in the i pocket and rolls it up.  INT: HOTEL LIVING ROOM - NIGHT He heads back into the living room but Tai isn’t there. H walks toward the bedroom and peeks inside. INT: HOTEL BEDROOM - NIGHT Lying on the bed is Tai and Kim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where’s Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He left. He said he wanted you to be very happy. She dims the lights. Wallace hesitates, then drops his ja and walks toward the bed. He climbs between the women and closes his eyes. EXT: PEARL STREET - NIGHT Henry Lee and the Sumo move across the street and descend through a loading door in the sidewalk. INT: BASEMENT-CONTINUOUS (NIGHT)  Lee and the Sumo reach a door and the Sumo knocks. Jack answers and lets them inside. INT: FUKIENESE CRASH PAD - PEARL STREET - NIGHT  A dozen Fukienese are there, from Bobby Vu to the newest groupie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police are running in circles on the unfortunate death of Uncle Benny. Jack tries to slowly position himself near Lee and Bobby

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want money. We didn’t kill him for nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s time to bring the cargo ship to port and unload our freight. One hundred eighty-six, at forty thousand a piece. I’d say that’s a nice start to our relationship, wouldn’t you? INT: HOTEL, BEDROOM - MORNING (DAY) Clock reads five AM. Wallace lies unconscious on the bed. the door, Kim takes the money from his wallet as Tai pull crumpled bills from his pants. She grabs his jacket, unrolls it and checks every pocket. stops when she hits the recorder. They whisper intently to each other, then quickly return recorder and the money to where they found them. Within seconds they’re gone. INT: CHEN’S APARTMENT, BEDROOM - MORNING (day) Chen carries a tray with soup and tea toward the bed wher rests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Chen pours the tea and she reaches out to touch his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Chen looks at her, then hands her the cup. He watches her drink...then finally speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have family here, friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one. Everybody home...everybody. Chen watches the tears fall from May’s eyes as she drinks thinks of home.  INT: BENEVOLENT ASSOCIATION, LARGE OFFICE - MORNING (DAY) Lee sits behind a large desk when Chen sits across from h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only time I was ever in here I was talking to Benny Wong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a great man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You’d know better than anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But even a great man can out last his time. Chen studies Lee and lights a smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’ve got something for you. Should quiet any doubts as to Wallace’s character...The Fukes are bringing in a highly valuable cargo by ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a short partnership.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby Vu will be on-site supervising the unloading. Take the Fukes and half the shipment. I’ll keep the other half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You’re getting greedy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m an American. INT: HOTEL BEDROOM - AFTERNOON Clock reads 1pm. Wallace is still sleeping in the dark wh sunlight explodes throughout the room with a WHOOSH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let’s go. We got to pick up Jack and deliver him to the Feds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time for a shower. You stink. Chen lifts the mattress, spilling Wallace out of the bed. then pops a cig into his mouth and checks his pants for a match...None.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a match? Chen picks up Wallace’s jacket and reaches into one of th pockets. Wallace’s eyes snap to attention as he quickly g a book of matches from the ashtray on the night stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. He tosses the pack and Chen catches it. Wallace watches h drop the jacket to the floor. His heart skips when he hea tink as the recorder hits the tile...Chen doesn’t notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you were right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what? Wallace crosses over, picks up his clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish it was neither of us. But truth is, I’m glad it’s not just me. Wallace looks at Chen, then heads for the bathroom. INT: BLUE EMPRESS CAFE - AFTERNOON Tai and Kim talk to the Sumo who’s sullen expression grow darker. He hands each girl a c-note and disappears into t cafe. INT: FEDERAL BUILDING, CONFERENCE ROOM - LATE AFTERNOON Wallace, Chen and Jack sit waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure it was Henry Lee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was him. Chen looks at Wallace as Schabacker and a middle-aged WOM with short red hair enter the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody knows U.S. Attorney Margaret Wheeler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tape is good. Probably enough for convictions on Bobby Vu and the rest. But I think we hold off until they make their move to bring in the illegal shipment. We bust ‘em on the ship. Then we go for the murder charge, the smuggling rap and with Jack here connecting the dots to an ongoing criminal enterprise, we meet our racketeering requirements and get life sentences.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Henry Lee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him, Nick? Wallace watches Schabacker play with Chen. He doesn’t lik

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we have a case, Pete?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There’s enough to drag him before a grand jury, but it’s gonna be his word against their word and he’ll win. We wait till after the shipment comes in, then the tape’s got merit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think, Danny? Wallace looks at Schabacker, who’s smiling through it all

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s Margaret’s call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we wait. Everybody’s on around the clock. As soon as Jack finds out when delivery is set, we’ll reconvene and organize the arrest. Margaret is first out of her seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick...after we bust the Fukes, you, Danny and me should get together... Bury the hatchet. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can’t wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me neither. How ‘bout you, Dan? You up for it? Schabacker smiles at Wallace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Wallace pushes past Schabacker and strides out of the roo   INT: CROWN VICTORIA - DAY Chen and Wallace cruise Chinatown in the big blue Ford. B men drive without saying a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think about Lee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think if Jack’s tape buries him it’s his fault for trying to be too smart for his own good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how long you think it’ll take him to trade for us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thirsty? I’m thirsty. Wallace pulls the car in front of a fire hydrant and toss the police tag on the dash. INT: JIMMY LOO'S - CONTINUOUS DAY Wallace and Chen pull up stools as the BARTENDER crosses

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bacardi and Coke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud. I’m buying. Wallace puts his money on the bar. Both men seem to have something on their minds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave that Fed to Lee. Wallace looks at Chen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. The bartender brings the drinks. Both wait for the man to on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m gonna have to answer for him some day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all have something to answer for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. They sit quietly...until Chen’s pager goes off. He checks number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak of the devil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Order me another. Chen picks up his drink and crosses to the phone. He pump a quarter, dials and waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s Chen, get me Lee. Chen finishes the drink as he waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where’ve you been. I’ve been paging you all morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallace is Internal Affairs. Chen feels his stomach tighten, but he’s not sure he got right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don’t believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your girlfriends found a wire on him last night. I checked it out and the fuck is making a case against you. The words hit Chen like a freight train. He stands speech His insides reeling as he looks over at his partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows how long he was wired...He’s got to go. Chen’s breath grows heavy as his eyes stare vacantly at Wallace, who’s working a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kill him tonight. Chen can’t answer either way, he’s not even sure if it’s or a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fukes are taking delivery in one hour. Pier 25 at Port Imperial in Jersey, a ship called the DORIAN. Take him along and make sure he doesn’t leave the boat...you understand me? I don’t give a shit about the cargo, the Fukes, nothing. Just make sure Wallace is dead. Are we clear? Chen doesn’t answer, he just keeps looking at Wallace, wh looking back at him now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He’ll hang us both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill him. Chen hangs up. He looks at Wallace, then pushes into... INT: JIMMY LOO'S BATHROOM - DAY He stands in the tiny room, half looking in the mirror, h looking nowhere. Eyes darting, mind racing. He turns on t water and runs it across his face, but it doesn’t really He reaches for a hand towel but it’s stuck in the dispens He rips down on the towel with all the rage, frustration anger inside him, tearing the metal dispenser from the wa and slamming it into the sink, the wall and finally to th ground. He then tries to steady himself, but he’s too ups But then his pager goes off. He calms himself, checks the number...then dials. A voice answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack...slow down...tonight, Pier 25, the Dorian. You did good, Jack. Where are you?...No, I’ll contact the F.B.I. I want you to stay at your girlfriend’s, don’t talk with anyone. After we pick up the others, I’ll come for you. Chen hangs up. He takes a breath and looks at himself in mirror. He runs his hands through his hair and slowly exi back into the bar. INT: JIMMY LOO'S - DAY His eyes stay on Wallace as he crosses the room. Only now look like he wants to kill him right there. He sits besid partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a hold of him? Chen takes a healthy gulp from his new drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you tell him about the tape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What’d he want? Chen looks directly into Wallace’s eyes. It takes him a m to get the words out of his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanted to tell me that the Fuke’s are picking up their shipment in an hour, in Jersey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, we gotta move. Did you call the Feds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. They’re going to meet us there. Chen finishes his drink and the two cops cross for the do omitted omitted   EXT: PORT IMPERIAL, DOCK 25 - DUSK A huge container ship sits silently at dock. We focus clo on the Wheelhouse. EXT: DOCK - NIGHT Through night vision goggles we see the adjacent parking All seems calm at the moment. INT: WHEELHOUSE - NIGHT Chen stands quietly in the darkness looking through the n vision goggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sign of anybody. He turns and hands the goggles to Wallace. Have a look. Wallace takes up the post as Chen steps back into the sha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee said an hour, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...still nothin’?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup...all clear. There’s a long pause. We watch Chen’s face turn to stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about Internal Affairs? Wallace flinches but covers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot to mention it. Lee thinks they’re making a case against someone in the fifteenth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn’t know. Maybe it’s just a rumour. You hear anything? Wallace is about to answer when he sees a tractor trailer into the lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They’re here. Take a look. He turns to give the goggles to Chen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No- you keep watching. We’ve got to let ‘em lead us to the cargo. EXT: CONTAINER SHIP - NIGHT  Through the goggles we Bobby Vu and the others be met by shipman and led to the far end of the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're heading away from us. INT: WHEELHOUSE - NIGHT Chen quietly cocks his gun and points it at the back of Wallace’s head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you do if you knew I.A. had a case against you? Would you run?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don’t know what I’d do. What would you do? Wallace is unaware of Chen standing directly behind him, building on his face- ready to pull the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean after I killed whoever ratted on me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallace’s blood turns to ice. He lowers the goggles, turn slowly and comes face to face with the barrel of Chen’s g It’s instantly clear Chen knows all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have let me die in the car that day. At least then I die a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a cop- a good cop. And I’ll tell anyone who asks. Chen hesitates. Not sure what to believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don’t know what I am. All I know is you saved me and you saved my father. My life is really yours to do with as you wish.  His words hang heavy in the air...and then Chen fires. Bu at Wallace. He fires past his head, through the glass of wheel house and hits the FUKENESE gangster who was about blow them away with an assault rifle. A beat, and automat fire comes from another window, spraying the wheelhouse w hot metal. Wallace takes out the shooter as Chen flies ou door.  Momentarily dazed, Wallace recovers, scrambles to his fee looks around, but Chen has disappeared.  INT/EXT: FUNNEL CHAMBER - NIGHT Wallace enters slowly and traverses the three storey high metal grate walkways. WE HEAR only the clank of his feet descends deep into the ship. omitted INT: ELECTRICAL ROOM - NIGHT Chen moves stealthily passed the huge humming generators, slowly approaching each blind curve. HE HEARS what sounds the distant cry of an infant. He keeps moving VIDEO SURVEILLANCE P.O.V. - NIGHT We see Chen move through the room towards the exit. An ar carrying an UZI passes in front of the camera. INT: ANCHOR ROOM - NIGHT Wallace cocks his ear to the same sound as he moves throu the room dominated by the giant chains that connect to th lowered anchors. Just at that moment a Fuke moves out fro behind the casing and gets off a shot that cuts right thr Wallace's left hand. He yelps in pain as he takes cover, the sleeve of his shirt to stem the bleeding, then waits the Fuke to make his move. He does- Wallace stands right him and takes him out in a fierce exchange. INT: ENGINE ROOM FIRST FLOOR - NIGHT The cavernous energy center of the ship. Four storey's hi cacophony of the brute force of the engines and the steel walkways that encircle them. Chen comes out on the bottom level. All seems quiet, exce for what seems like the distant hum of human whispering. moves slowly out into the open. The place seems empty unt suddenly a shape appears on the metal catwalk two storey' above. He turns with lightening speed- points, ready to s at...Wallace. There's a tense standoff. Neither wants to lower their we first. The sound of distant murmuring grows louder until suddenly the standoff is ended by a common enemy. Wallace whips around and sends a fuke who was about to shoot him flying back against a wall. Chen suddenly finds a Fuke charging down metal stairs towards him. He blasts him bef he can get a shot off- the Fukes lifeless body tobogannin down to land at Chen’s feet.  One holdout, BLACK EYES, equipped with an AK47 on the top floor will not be taken out. Like some madman on crack he sprays crazily in every direction until finally Chen just for it stepping out into the open and pummeling BLACK EYE with bullets. A pipe behind the Fuke explodes with steam, enveloping Black eyes who falls limply onto a vertical cr Chen and Wallace relax a beat and then BANG! Black Eyes i and charging Wallace. Chen is faster, spraying him with everything left in his weapon, hitting and igniting a fue pipe which spills out it’s fiery liquid setting BLACK EYE aflame. The dying Fuke grabs onto some hanging rope and i last defiant act, swings down the three storeys all the t firing and coming almost face to face with Chen before be finally silenced- his incinerated corpse landing at Chen’ feet. Wallace scans the area while he descends the stairs towar Chen. There are no Fukes in sight. The human murmuring gr louder. Without speaking, Chen and Wallace move towards t source of the sounds. INT: PASSAGEWAY ANTEROOM - NIGHT Chen and Wallace move slowly down the few steps to a heav steel door beyond which the sounds seems to emanate. With silent gestures they work like the partners they've becom Wallace opening the door and stepping back, covering Chen he makes his move. INT: PASSAGEWAY - NIGHT Nothing could have prepared them for what they find on th other side of the door. There, as far as the eye can see, running the entire length of the ship, is the cargo Lee awarded the Fuke's. Several hundred illegal Chinese immig huddled together in unspeakable conditions, stuffed into tiny opening that resemble's an endless train compartment Their dark vacant eyes stare back at the shocked cops who cautiously through the passageway. It doesn't take long f the remaining Fuke's to make their presence known with a bullet destined for Chen, and intercepted by the back of innocent young male immigrant. Chen, Wallace and the desperate group of illegals flatten themselves against the sides of the corridor. SILENCE Chen steps out quickly as if to take a shot, but it's a s punch as he immediately tucks himself back in then out ag just in time to duck the bullet from a Fuke and plant his squarely in the gangster's chest. Chen ducks back behind the steel separators that occur ab every twenty feet in the passageway. Wallace is one "compartment" back. A young boy, no more than six years o drifts out into harm’s way. Wallace reaches out quickly a pulls him to his side. While Wallace keeps quard, the kid holds onto his hand and begins to sympathetically rub his bandage- his eyes pleading for salvation of any kind. Che looks back sees this and Wallace's empathic reaction to p the young kid on the head. Chen hesitates a second, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wallace... Wallace snaps to. Chen indicates for him to follow as he sprints out and moves quickly down the narrow tunnel past endless collection of immigrant pawns. We see their desperation not only in their faces, but in their patheti little bundles that contain all their worldly belongings. mutter Cantonese pleas. Quiet...quiet. They come to a stop. Listen a moment to the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that's all of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby Vu's here, and he'll never leave without us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without you. Wallace moves out quickly out into the passageway as if taunting Vu to make his move. He stops two compartments d Chen is one compartment behind. They exchange looks. Chen indicates to "stay put". Wallace peaks out from behind the steel. One of the oldes women in the hold, a grandmotherly face of China, motions Wallace to come closer. Come here, boy. Come to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I know where they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? Come here. Chen watches as Wallace moves out and approaches the woma Suddenly the image goes into hyper slo-mo. We see the wom mouthing the Cantonese words for "come here". Back on Che there suddenly something wrong. He looks closely at the o woman, and then, operating purely on instinct, he races forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as Wallace steps up to the woman, CHEN pushes Wallac aside and takes the automatic fire that Bobby Vu shoots f behind an innocent skirt. Wallace immediately raises his and fires two in the chest and one in the head. Just like taught him. Bobby Vu’s body hits the floor with a thud. D Wallace looks down at Chen as the blood begins spreading around him. Quickly, he kneels beside his partner, gather in his arm and tries to control the bleeding, but the wou deep. He turns toward a commotion at the entrance to the tunnel and sees a bunch of Feds and uniforms heading towa him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring a stretcher!! (to Chen) Come on, hang on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Chen tries to catch his breath, but he can’t seem to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You’re alright. You’re OK. Chen’s body spasms from the pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Chen grabs hold of Wallace’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who sends a white cop undercover in Chinatown? Wallace looks into Chen’s eyes. He’s fading in and out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick...can ya hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick...it’s just you and me...I’m your partner. A tiny smile escapes from Chen just before he loses consciousness and is surrounded by an EMS team. omitted omitted  omitted   INT: HOSPITAL CORRIDOR-DAY Kirpatrick, a manila envelope in his hand, rushes down th hallway with Schabacker. They hurry to the Intensive Care ward stopping outside a where a uniformed OFFICER stands guard. Through the windo the door they can see Wallace leaning close to Chen who l motionless in the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get Wallace out here. The Officer doesn’t move so Schabacker pulls out his FBI and shoves it close to the cops face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now. The Officer gets up slowly from his chair as the door swi open and Wallace exits from the room. He looks at the two then starts down the hall when Kirpatrick slaps him acros chest with the manila envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What’s this bullshit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly what it says. That after a month long investigation, there’s no evidence to support any charges against Lt. Nicholas Chen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you can get away with this forget it. He’s responsible for the death of a Federal Agent. An ICU team races down the hall and charges into Chen’s r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chen’s dead. Schabacker and Kirpatrick don’t say a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And no matter what you believe, the officer in that room died a good cop. Wallace looks them in the eye, then pushes past them and continues down the hall. INT: AMY SAN’S APRATMENT, BROOKLYN-DAY Jack opens the door and sees Wallace standing in the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to take care of Henry Lee. INT: BLUE EMPRESS CAFE - DAY  Lee sits at a table with a white, middle aged MAN in a pi striped suit. Wallace, Ung and Deng enter the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry Lee, you’re under arrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’d like to introduce you to my attorney, Mr. Cotten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’d like to introduce you to the inmates at Riker’s Island, but that’ll take a few weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your optimism is refreshing. Lee gets up, along with his attorney. He turns to Wallace

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was very saddened to hear about your friend, Lt. Chen...Oh, I’m sorry, he wasn’t your friend after all, was he? Lee puts on his coat and leans close to Wallace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I’d like to thank you for killing all the witnesses against me. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not all. Not the one who recorded this tape. Wallace plays a short sample of Jack’s tape and the smile fades from Lee’s face...which makes Wallace smile as Deng Ung lead Lee out in cuffs. omitted INT: CHEN’S APARTMENT, LIVING ROOM - DAY Wallace sits across from May. He slides an envelope in fr of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanted you to have this. She opens the envelope. Inside is a "green card" clearly indicating "OFFICIAL U.S. RESIDENCY STATUS."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this. Wallace takes out the envelope of money his father tossed the floor and gives it to May who’s eyes well with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna be alright? Yes...thank you. She gets up and gives Wallace an appreciative kiss on the cheek. EXT: ELIZABETH STREET-DAY End credits roll as the NYPD honor and bury their own. In funeral procession that draws on traditional Chinese cult as well as present day police decorum, the men and women serve and protect parade down the small Chinatown street full dress blues. Banners depicting the face of Nick Chen wave out front as coffin, draped in the American flag draws cheers from the people of Chinatown. And no one louder than Detective Dan Wallace. THE END
